# Defining a plot method for a specific class

Plotting requires the class to have specific structure

First we define an arbitrary object, `myobj`, along with its class, `myclass`.

```{r}
myobj <- list(
  x = 1:10,
  y = sample(10)
)
class(myobj) <- c("myclass")
```

Plotting requires to define a method for the generic `plot` function. This is likewise easy:

```{r}
plot.myclass <- function(myobj){
  plot(myobj$x, myobj$y, type="b")
}
print.myclass <- function(myobj){
  cat("Myobj:", "\n\tx:", paste(myobj$x, collapse = ",\t"), "\n\ty:", paste(myobj$y, collapse=",\t"))
}
update.myclass <- function(myobj){
  myobj$y[1] <- myobj$y[1]+1
  myobj
}
```

```{r}
print(myobj)
```


```{r}
plot(myobj)
```
